channel.title: Problem Opening my Server to public
channel.description: All right guys, I recently changed my internet providers and I changed my Router, I already portfoward my IP (from cmd>ipconfig) but people can't enter the server, cause in Manage Host (no-ip.com) I put this IP, but it changes again to my public IP, how can I fix this guys? Thanks

ummm did not help at all?

item.title: Problem Opening my Server to public
item.dc:creator: @Arkamys Arkamys
item.description:
@Arkamys wrote:

xJavac:

You can’t portfoward your public ip --. Instead of ipconfig go too Network and Sharing Center, click on the network connection your using, click “Details” and get your ipv4 from there… you should only have too portfoward if you’re on a network --.

Translation:

IPv4 Conection: Internet
IPv6 Conection: No access to Network

Thanks on Network and Sharing Center.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem Opening my Server to public
item.dc:creator: @Arkamys Arkamys
item.description:
@Arkamys wrote:

Look this is what I’ve tried so far.

I tried to Portfoward my Public IP (187.something.something.something) but… in the Router page it appears: IP not Valid.
So I used : cmd > ipconfig and on router page putted my IPv4 and opened 43594 on both protocol (UDP/TCP) but is not working…

On client.java (cliente sided) I putted my IPv4 and is not working.

Read full topic
item.source: Problem Opening my Server to public

item.title: Problem Opening my Server to public
item.dc:creator: @xJavac xJavac
item.description:
@xJavac wrote:

Arkamys:

So what are you saying is that in where the IP is loaded I put my IPv4 and just portforward it?

Maybe I’m a bit confused :l. You don’t have too portfoward if you’re not using a Router lol; you can just put your ipv4 address where the ip is loaded. If you have too portfoward though, then go ahead and do that and still place your normal public ipv4 where the ip is loaded, not your network ipv4 though.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem Opening my Server to public
item.dc:creator: @xJavac xJavac
item.description:
@xJavac wrote:

Why u using no-ip :x. People can still grab your ip; I can if you want me too when you get this setup :l. But anywho, I’m not sure whats up with no-ip, I don’t think its your fault, but also; theres no difference using no-ip and your real ip. either way you still have ports open ;P. People can’t do nothing with your ip other then flood it (DDoS), and that’s only if you have really bad firewall.

Read full topic
item.source: Problem Opening my Server to public

item.title: Problem Opening my Server to public
item.dc:creator: @Arkamys Arkamys
item.description:
@Arkamys wrote:

Maybe I did not explain myself correct…

Ok.

With my old Router (linksys) I had a Private IP [192.168.0.something]
But when I changed my internet providers they gave me a D-Link DIR600 and I don’t have any private IP anymore I have a public… [187.something.something.something].

When I go to no-ip.com and put my IPv4 (from ipconfig) and click update(refresh) on the no-ip application it put me again my public IP on my host; I tried what you suggested above ultimatepkvillage, but I don’t seems to be working… any other idea?

Thank You.

Read full topic
